page.title: 07LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Chasetown Police Station is a modern building in the High Street and has one cell. Based at the station in one shift there are 3 officers, 1 sergeant and an inspector. There are two incident response vehicles, one police van, traffic vehicles and a support unit. Every crime is recorded on computer and the C.I.D. is called in as required. Crimes committed in Chasetown include burglary, cycle-theft, assault, theft of milk and vandalism. The most frequent crime committed is theft of motor vehicles. Crime and the activities of the police receive a lot of attention from the local newspapers. The most often reported instances are petty theft and vandalism. The age group which committed the most crimes is that between 18 and 21.
